I have submitted it on the roadmap in an effort to prioritise it. A nice stop gap, while its still in a fixed format, I think would be to at least move away from dd/MM/yyyy and MM/dd/yyyy as this format is what creates the most confusion for non-US based countries. In my opinion, using a format such as yyyy-MM-dd would at least be different and standard enough that it would work internationally.
There would probably be some content editors and marketers that wouldn't like that format, but you can never impress everyone.
